user_management

Class UserFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • user_management.UserFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CourierFactory, CustomerFactory, ManagerFactory, RestaurantFactory

    public abstract class UserFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Abstract UserFactory, part of the Factory-Pattern to create users.
    Author:
    maxspahn, jeremyaugot
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createAccount

        public abstract void createAccount(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String userName,
                                   java.lang.String passWord,
                                   java.lang.String phone,
                                   java.lang.String email,
                                   int[] adress)
                            throws SameUserNameException
        Method to create a new account, uses createAccountNextStep() method. Asks for all the attributes in common between all the users.
        Throws:
        SameUserNameException

      • login

        public User login(java.lang.String userName,
                  java.lang.String password)
           throws WrongUserNameOrPassWordException
        Method to login to an existing account.
        Parameters:
        userName - Name of user to login.
        password - User's password.
        Returns:
        The user object.
        Throws:
        WrongUserNameOrPassWordException

      • load

        public abstract void load()
        Abstract method to load the users who are already inserted in the system. The function is overriden by every specific user-type.

      • addUserToLists

        public void addUserToLists(User user)
        A method which adds the user in the user list and the list in which he/she belongs.
        Parameters:
        user - User to be added to the system.

      • checkExistenceUserName

        public boolean checkExistenceUserName(java.lang.String userName)
        Method to check if the userName already exists.
        Parameters:
        userName - User to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the user has already been registered in the system.
